Hubot is a chat bot written in CoffeeScript on Node.js. It is a standardized way to share scripts between everyone's robots.

---

# Hubot Script: `frostedio-env`

[![wercker status](https://app.wercker.com/status/47dbe99c79b55b75f02ed12a53be906c/s "wercker status")](https://app.wercker.com/project/bykey/47dbe99c79b55b75f02ed12a53be906c) [![Known Vulnerabilities](https://snyk.io/test/npm/hubot-frostedio-env/badge.svg)](https://snyk.io/test/npm/hubot-frostedio-env)

## Requirements

In order to run this Hubot script, you will need the following:

* an up-to-date installation of [Hubot](https://hubot.github.com/)
* an up-to-date version of this script

## Installation

To install this script, run the following command in your console, in a directory where Hubot is installed:

```
npm install --save hubot-frostedio-env
```

Following that, add `hubot-frostedio-env` to your `external-scripts.json`:

```
[
  'hubot-frostedio-env'
]
```

### Usage

In order to use `hubot-frostedio-env`, send a message to your Hubot saying `env`:

```
<user> hubot env
<hubot> HUBOT_AWS_REGION: us-west-1
HUBOT_S3_BRAIN_FILE_PATH: hubot/brain-dump.json
```

### Notes

`hubot-frostedio-env` will only print out environment variables with the `HUBOT_` prefix.

Additionally, it is important to understand that printing out environment variables can lead to leaking information such as AWS access credentials.

It is recommended to use `hubot-frostedio-env` when developing locally and in combination with the shell adapter.
